We track the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic on political preferences through its \u201chigh\u201d and \u201clow\u201d phases in the Czech Republic. Uniquely, we ask about the effects of both the health and the economic costs of the pandemic measured at both personal and municipality levels. Consistent with the literature, we estimate effects suggestive of political accountability of leaders during \u201chigh\u201d pandemic phases without higher support for non-democratic alternatives. However, we also find that the pandemic political accountability effects are mostly short-lived, and do not extend to the first post-pandemic elections.<\/jats:p>","DOI":"10.1177\/10659129251324220","type":"journal-article","created":{"date-parts":[[2025,3,12]],"date-time":"2025-03-12T23:18:36Z","timestamp":1741821516000},"page":"860-874","update-policy":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1177\/sage-journals-update-policy","source":"Crossref","is-referenced-by-count":0,"title":["Political Preferences Through Stages of the COVID-19 Pandemic"],"prefix":"10.1177","volume":"78","author":[{"given":"Alena","family":"Bi\u010d\u00e1kov\u00e1","sequence":"first","affiliation":[]},{"ORCID":"https:\/\/orcid.org\/0000-0001-6176-2656","authenticated-orcid":false,"given":"\u0160t\u011bp\u00e1n","family":"Jurajda","sequence":"additional","affiliation":[{"name":"CERGE-EI, Praha, Czech Republic"}]}],"member":"179","published-online":{"date-parts":[[2025,3,12]]},"reference":[{"key":"e_1_3_6_2_1","volume-title":"Democracy for Realists","author":"Achen Christopher H.","year":"2017","unstructured":"Achen Christopher H., Bartels Larry M.. 2017.
